title: PHPacos()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPacos()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Return the arc cosine of different numbers: "); echo(acos(-0.4) . "
"); echo(acos(0) . "
"); echo(acos(-1) . "
"); echo(acos(1) . "
"); echo(acos(2)); ?> Definition and Usage The acos() function returns the arc cosine of a number. Tip: acos(-1) returns the value of Pi. Syntax acos( number ); Parameter Values Parameter Description number Required. Specifies a number in range -1 to 1 Technical Details Return Value: The arc cosine of a number. Returns NAN if number is not in the range -1 to 1 Return Type: Float PHP Version: 4+ ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
"); echo(acos(-0.4) . "
"); echo(acos(0) . "
"); echo(acos(-1) . "
"); echo(acos(1) . "
"); echo(acos(2)); ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPacos()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPacos()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPacos()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
